availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alexander Clay Semple (Louisville resident and soldier, served as assistant to General Boyle.)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania native. Son of Alexander B. Semple, Louisville iron merchant. Married to Sarah Slaughter Semple on May, 13, 1858. Father of Hattie M. Semple, George Castleman Semple, and Lily Semple. Iron and hardware merchant in Louisville from 1860 to 1900. Served as assistant to General Boyle.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jeffereson County, Louisville, p. 46

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 222

“Erysipelas: Causes death of Alexander C. Semple,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), December 31, 1904, p. 12.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000482708, p 80
